definitions.definition: An order that releases a convicted criminal without further punishment, prevents future punishment, or (in some jurisdictions) removes an offence from a person's criminal record , as if it had never been committed.
examples: The President [ … ] shall have Power to grant Reprieves and Pardons for Offences against the United States, except in Cases of Impeachment.

secondary_definitions: ( law ) An order that releases a convicted criminal without further punishment, prevents future punishment, or (in some jurisdictions) removes an offence from a person's criminal record , as if it had never been committed.
